conclusion: Analyze the paths of the liquids from points A, B, C, and D to determine which container (E or F) the liquid will flow into.
Liquid flows down the red baffle from point A.
Liquid moves horizontally to the right after flowing down the red baffle.
Liquid continues down the black baffle after moving horizontally.
Liquid from point A will flow into container F.
Liquid flows down the green baffle from point B.
Liquid moves horizontally to the right after flowing down the green baffle.
Liquid continues down the white baffle after moving horizontally.
Liquid from point B will flow into container F.
Liquid flows down the gray baffle from point C.
Liquid moves horizontally to the right after flowing down the gray baffle.
Liquid continues down the pink baffle after moving horizontally.
Liquid from point C will flow into container F.
Liquid flows down the blue baffle from point D.
Liquid moves horizontally to the right after flowing down the blue baffle.
Liquid continues down the black baffle after moving horizontally.
Liquid from point D will flow into container F.
All liquids from points A, B, C, and D will flow into container F.
The liquid will flow into container F.
